headline: Newark police awarded $96K from state to start body cam program
author: Michaela Sumner
sentences: Earlier this week, Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced more than $4.7 million in grant funding was being awarded to over 100 local law enforcement agencies "for expenses associated with launching or maintaining body-worn camera programs."

Additional funding for body-worn cameras will be offered as part of funding set aside for law enforcement in December by DeWine and the Ohio General Assembly.
The Ohio Body-Worn Camera Grant Program was created in the state's 2022-2023 operating budget, which was passed by the Ohio General Assembly last year.
